alert.note: Alert for Cascade County below 5000ft; Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera; Eastern Pondera and Eastern Teton; Eastern Toole and Liberty; Gates of the Mountains; Northern High Plains; Southern High Plains; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 10 at 1:58PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Moderate to heavy snow will impact portions of North-Central Montana through 230 PM MST... At 154 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking moderate to heavy snow along a line extending from near Valier to 9 miles southeast of Fort Shaw. Movement was east northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Moderate to heavy snow and visibility as low as a half mile or less. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hazardous driving conditions. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Conrad, Choteau, Cascade, Fairfield, Belt, Valier, Dutton, Fort Shaw, Brady, The Knees, Highwood, Black Eagle, Fort Shaw, Power, Carter, Dupuyer, Floweree, Stockett and First Peoples Buffalo Jump State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
